title: Trump to Unveil Farmer Aid as China Shuns U.S. Crops
summary: As it did in 2018, the White House plans to dole out relief funds to struggling U.S. farmers who have lost their biggest customer.

title: In 2020, Trump Intervened in Portland’s Protests. They Got Even Worse.
summary: Here are five lessons for cities in the president’s sights, like Chicago and Memphis, drawn from the one city targeted by Mr. Trump in his first term, Portland, Ore.

title: Trump Considers Insurrection Act, and Flights Slow During Government Shutdown
summary: Plus, a new way to fight robocalls.

title: Israel Marks Two-Year Anniversary of Oct. 7 in Subdued Fashion
summary: The second anniversary of the Oct. 7 attacks comes with peace talks underway, but with hostages still in Gaza, more than 67,000 Palestinians dead and Israel more isolated than ever before.

title: A Former Israeli Hostage Is Freed From Hamas, but Not Captivity
summary: In the tunnels of Gaza where she was held captive, Emily Damari learned how to survive. These photos show her learning to be alive again.

title: Supreme Court Hears Free Speech Challenge to Ban on Conversion Therapy
summary: The court’s ruling in the Colorado case will have implications for more than 20 other states with similar laws.

title: A Debate Over ‘Conversion Therapy,’ Once Widely Condemned, Is Back
summary: As more young people identify as transgender, a fight has re-emerged over therapy that questions their gender identities.

title: Supreme Court, for Now, Rejects Google Bid to Block Changes to App Store
summary: The emergency order is the latest turn in a longstanding legal dispute between the tech giant and the creator of the popular game Fortnite.

title: Shutdown Politics Has Republicans Singing Government’s Praises
summary: As Republicans try to pin blame for shutdown damage on Democrats, they are hailing a federal bureaucracy they normally bash as wasteful and overreaching.

title: Flight Delays Begin as Air Traffic Staffing Shortages Worsen
summary: The delays came just hours after the transportation secretary warned that flying could be disrupted by the government shutdown.

title: With Sébastien Lecornu’s Resignation, France Faces Increasing Turmoil
summary: The record-fast collapse of yet another government confronts President Emmanuel Macron and his country with an intensifying crisis.

title: France’s Government Is Gone (Again). What Comes Next?
summary: President Emmanuel Macron could appoint a new prime minister. But he is under increasing pressure to call new parliamentary elections.

title: Nobel Prize in Physics Is Awarded for Work in Quantum Mechanics
summary: The prize was awarded to John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret and John M. Martinis.

title: Winning a Nobel Prize Interrupted His Off-the-Grid Vacation
summary: Fred Ramsdell found out about his Nobel Prize nearly 12 hours after it was announced because he was on vacation in the Rockies.

title: Nobel Prizes 2025: What to Know
summary: The awards are being announced this week.

title: Is Adams’s Exit a Game-Changer for Cuomo? Not So Far.
summary: There has been little evidence that Mayor Eric Adams’s decision to end his re-election bid has had a major effect on Andrew Cuomo’s bid to attract donors or voters.

title: Where in the World Is Eric Adams? Try Albania.
summary: The decision by Mr. Adams, a lame-duck mayor, to spend nearly a week of his remaining time in office visiting the Balkan nation raised eyebrows back in New York.

title: In a Toxic World, Pets Could Be Vital Health Watchdogs
summary: A better understanding of how pollution affects pets could benefit humans and animals alike.

title: How to Protect Your Pets From Pollution
summary: Wildfire smoke, lead paint and other environmental toxins are health hazards for animals, too.

title: Recruiters Use A.I. to Scan Résumés. Applicants Are Trying to Trick It.
summary: In an escalating cat-and-mouse game, job hunters are trying to fool A.I. into moving their applications to the top of the pile with embedded instructions.

title: He Was Expected to Get Alzheimer’s 25 Years Ago. Why Hasn’t He?
summary: Scientists are searching for the secret in Doug Whitney’s biology that has protected him from dementia, hoping it could lead to ways to treat or prevent Alzheimer’s for many other people.

title: Lessons From a Long War
summary: The only viable path to a Palestinian state is an end to the fantasy of Israel’s destruction.

title: No, Trump Can’t Order Troops to Wherever He Wants
summary: The president’s claims about cities don’t hold up.

title: President Trump and the Military
summary: Today, we look at how Trump melds his politics with his role as head of the armed forces.

title: Jimmy Kimmel Says His Numbers Are Better Than Trump’s
summary: Kimmel is keeping the results of a new poll in perspective: “At this point, finding a toenail in your salad has a seven-point lead over Donald Trump.”

title: In Tennessee Special Election, a Crowded Field for an Open Congressional Seat
summary: More than a dozen candidates are vying to represent the state’s Seventh Congressional District, which includes part of Nashville but was redrawn to favor Republicans.

title: France’s Energy Giant Sees Opportunity in the Volatile Electricity Market
summary: Hoping to help grid operators adapt to changes buffeting the power markets, TotalEnergies is assembling a portfolio of battery farms and natural-gas-fired power plants.

title: Ken Jacobs, Visionary Experimental Filmmaker, Is Dead at 92
summary: Using found footage and toying with dimensions (2-D could seem like dazzling 3-D), he sought to explode cinema’s traditional boundaries.

title: Can Sweet Songs Prevail Over Bloody Ones? Mexico Is Giving It a Try.
summary: On Sunday, three contestants were crowned winners of the inaugural, government-run “Mexico Sings” competition, meant to promote songs that aren’t about drug cartels or violence.
